intro: Valeriana notha, commonly known as narrowleaf valerian, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its roots contain essential oils and have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their sedative properties. Valeriana notha is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along stream banks.
